commands.name: title
commands.label: \title
commands.documentation: Sets the title text for the score. Commonly shown in the score header.

commands.name: subtitle
commands.label: \subtitle
commands.documentation: Sets a subtitle or secondary title for the score.

commands.name: artist
commands.label: \artist
commands.documentation: Sets the artist/performer associated with the score.

commands.name: album
commands.label: \album
commands.documentation: Sets album information for the score.

commands.name: composer
commands.label: \composer
commands.documentation: Sets composer information for the score.

commands.name: arranger
commands.label: \arranger
commands.documentation: Sets arranger information.

commands.name: date
commands.label: \date
commands.documentation: Sets the date string for the score.

commands.name: copyright
commands.label: \copyright
commands.documentation: Sets a copyright notice for the score.

commands.name: tempo
commands.label: \tempo
commands.documentation: Sets the playback tempo in beats-per-minute (BPM).

commands.name: time
commands.label: \time
commands.documentation: Sets the time signature for the piece (e.g., 4/4, 3/4).

commands.name: meter
commands.label: \meter
commands.documentation: Sets meter information for the score. Often used alongside time signature.

commands.name: key
commands.label: \key
commands.documentation: Sets the key signature (e.g., C, G, D minor).

commands.name: clef
commands.label: \clef
commands.documentation: Sets which clef to use (e.g., treble, bass, alto).

commands.name: capo
commands.label: \capo
commands.documentation: Indicates the capo fret position for guitar or similar instruments.

commands.name: transpose
commands.label: \transpose
commands.documentation: Transpose the playback or notation by a number of semitones.

commands.name: ts
commands.label: \ts
commands.documentation: Shorthand for some time/tempo related transformations or a short-time signature command.

commands.name: track
commands.label: \track
commands.documentation: Selects or creates a track (instrument/voice).

commands.name: instrument
commands.label: \instrument
commands.documentation: Sets the instrument for the current track/voice.

commands.name: program
commands.label: \program
commands.documentation: Sets the MIDI program/bank or soundfont to use for a track.

commands.name: channel
commands.label: \channel
commands.documentation: Sets the MIDI channel for the track.

commands.name: lyrics
commands.label: \lyrics
commands.documentation: Inserts lyric lines or lyrics for notes.

commands.name: lyric
commands.label: \lyric
commands.documentation: Add lyric associated with a particular note.

commands.name: repeat
commands.label: \repeat
commands.documentation: Start a repeat block for measures. Use `\endrepeat` to close

commands.name: endrepeat
commands.label: \endrepeat
commands.documentation: Ends a `\repeat` block.

commands.name: measure
commands.label: \measure
commands.documentation: Insert measure-specific metadata or attributes.

commands.name: bar
commands.label: \bar
commands.documentation: Adds a barline or barline style marker.

commands.name: note
commands.label: \note
commands.documentation: Insert a single note or a note modifier depending on context.

commands.name: chord
commands.label: \chord
commands.documentation: Insert chord name or power chord information for a given beat.

commands.name: volume
commands.label: \volume
commands.documentation: Set playback volume for this track or note.

commands.name: pan
commands.label: \pan
commands.documentation: Set left-right stereo pan position.

commands.name: mute
commands.label: \mute
commands.documentation: Mute the current track.

commands.name: solo
commands.label: \solo
commands.documentation: Solo the current track for playback.

commands.name: scoreinfo
commands.label: \scoreinfo
commands.documentation: Set various metadata or informational fields on the score.

properties.name: f
properties.label: f
properties.documentation: A beat-level property; commonly used for dynamics or effects.

properties.name: p
properties.label: p
properties.documentation: A beat-level property for dynamics (piano).

properties.name: mf
properties.label: mf
properties.documentation: Mid-level dynamic mark.

properties.name: stacc
properties.label: stacc
properties.documentation: A note-level articulation property (staccato).

properties.name: accent
properties.label: accent
properties.documentation: A note-level articulation indicating accent.

properties.name: sustain
properties.label: sustain
properties.documentation: Indicates a sustained note (long/legato).

properties.name: duration
properties.label: duration
properties.documentation: Control the length/duration of the note/beat (e.g., 4., 8).

properties.name: fo
properties.label: fo
properties.documentation: Adds a fade-out effect to the beat. Applies to all notes.

properties.name: vs
properties.label: vs
properties.documentation: Adds a volume-swell effect to the beat. Applies to all notes.

properties.name: v
properties.label: v
properties.documentation: Adds a slight vibrato effect to the beat. Applies to all notes.

properties.name: vw
properties.label: vw
properties.documentation: Adds a wide vibrato effect to the beat. Applies to all notes.

properties.name: s
properties.label: s
properties.documentation: Adds a bass slap annotation to the beat.

properties.name: tt
properties.label: tt
properties.documentation: Adds a guitar or bass tapping annotation to the beat.

properties.name: d
properties.label: d
properties.documentation: Marks the beat with a single augmentation dot.

properties.name: dd
properties.label: dd
properties.documentation: Marks the beat with a double augmentation dot.

properties.name: su
properties.label: su
properties.documentation: Adds an upwards pick-stroke annotation to the beat.

properties.name: sd
properties.label: sd
properties.documentation: Adds an downwards pick-stroke annotation to the beat.

properties.name: cre
properties.label: cre
properties.documentation: Adds a crescendo effect to the beat.

properties.name: dec
properties.label: dec
properties.documentation: Adds a decrescendo (diminuendo) effect to the beat.

properties.name: spd
properties.label: spd
properties.documentation: Add a sustain pedal down-press to the beat.

properties.name: sph
properties.label: sph
properties.documentation: Add a sustain pedal hold to the beat.

properties.name: spu
properties.label: spu
properties.documentation: Add a sustain pedal up (release) to the beat.

properties.name: spe
properties.label: spe
properties.documentation: Add a sustain pedal up (release) to the end of the beat.

properties.name: slashed
properties.label: slashed
properties.documentation: Marks the beat to be displayed with slash notation.

properties.name: ds
properties.label: ds
properties.documentation:
Marks the beat to be a dead-slap beat.

As no notes should be on such a beat, simply use () to indicate the empty beat which is not a rest.

properties.name: glpf
properties.label: glpf
properties.documentation: Adds a golpe finger-tap effect to the beat.

properties.name: glpt
properties.label: glpt
properties.documentation: Adds a golpe thumb-tap effect to the beat.

properties.name: waho
properties.label: waho
properties.documentation: Adds a Wah-pedal opening effect to the beat.

properties.name: wahc
properties.label: wahc
properties.documentation: Adds a Wah-pedal close effect to the beat.

properties.name: legatoOrigin
properties.label: legatoOrigin
properties.documentation: Adds a legato from this beat to the next one.

properties.name: timer
properties.label: timer
properties.documentation:
Adds a timestamp marker to the beat.

Timers are showing the exact timestamp when a beat is played the first time (respecting aspects like repeats).

properties.name: tu
properties.label: tu
properties.documentation:
Adds a tuplet to the beat duration.

There are some built-in simple tuplet variants or you can specify the exact division.

properties.name: txt
properties.label: txt
properties.documentation: Adds a text annotation to the beat.

properties.name: lyrics
properties.label: lyrics
properties.documentation:
Adds a lyric text to the beat.

This is an alternative way of applying the exact lyrics to beats instead of using the `\lyrics` metadata where a special syntax is used to spread the text across beats.

properties.name: tb
properties.label: tb
properties.documentation:
Adds a whammy bar (aka. tremolo bar) effect to the beat.

* The `tb` variant automatically spreads the values across the duration of the beat.
* The `tbe` (exact) variant allows specifying exactly at which offset a value is placed.

It is recommended to rely on the auto-detection of the type and only specify the type explicitly if something is wrong.

properties.name: tbe
properties.label: tbe
properties.documentation:
Adds a whammy bar (aka. tremolo bar) effect to the beat.

* The `tb` variant automatically spreads the values across the duration of the beat.
* The `tbe` (exact) variant allows specifying exactly at which offset a value is placed.
 
It is recommended to rely on the auto-detection of the type and only specify the type explicitly if something is wrong.

properties.name: bu
properties.label: bu
properties.documentation: Adds a brush stroke effect to the beat.

properties.name: bd
properties.label: bd
properties.documentation: Adds a brush stroke effect to the beat.

properties.name: au
properties.label: au
properties.documentation: Adds an arpeggio effect to the beat.

properties.name: ad
properties.label: ad
properties.documentation: Adds an arpeggio effect to the beat.

properties.name: ch
properties.label: ch
properties.documentation:
Adds a chord annotation to the beat.

If the staff has a definition for this chord it will be shown in the chord diagram list to indicate its usage. The beat still has to define the notes separately.

properties.name: gr
properties.label: gr
properties.documentation: Marks the beat as a grace beat holding grace notes.

properties.name: dy
properties.label: dy
properties.documentation: Defines the play dynamics for this beat.

properties.name: tempo
properties.label: tempo
properties.documentation: Add a tempo change to the beat.

properties.name: volume
properties.label: volume
properties.documentation:
Add a volume change to the beat.

The change affects all beats after this one.

properties.name: balance
properties.label: balance
properties.documentation:
Add a balance (pan) change to the beat.

The change affects all beats after this one.

properties.name: tp
properties.label: tp
properties.documentation: Add a tremolo picking to the beat.

properties.name: barre
properties.label: barre
properties.documentation: Add a barré chord notation to the beat.

properties.name: rasg
properties.label: rasg
properties.documentation: Add a rasgueado play pattern to the beat.

properties.name: ot
properties.label: ot
properties.documentation: Adds a octave change (ottava) to the beat.

properties.name: instrument
properties.label: instrument
properties.documentation: Adds a instrument change to the beat.

properties.name: bank
properties.label: bank
properties.documentation: Adds a instrument bank change to the beat.

properties.name: fermata
properties.label: fermata
properties.documentation: Adds a fermata to the beat.

properties.name: beam
properties.label: beam
properties.documentation:
Changes the beaming and stem direction for the beat.
Can be specified multiple times.

properties.name: nh
properties.label: nh
properties.documentation: Applies a natural harmonic effect to the note (for fretted instruments).

properties.name: ah
properties.label: ah
properties.documentation: Applies an artificial harmonic effect to the note (for fretted instruments).

properties.name: th
properties.label: th
properties.documentation: Applies a tapped harmonic effect to the note (for fretted instruments).

properties.name: ph
properties.label: ph
properties.documentation: Applies a pinch harmonic effect to the note (for fretted instruments).

properties.name: sh
properties.label: sh
properties.documentation: Applies a semi harmonic effect to the note (for fretted instruments).

properties.name: fh
properties.label: fh
properties.documentation: Applies a feedback harmonic effect to the note (for fretted instruments).

properties.name: sl
properties.label: sl
properties.documentation: Adds a legato slide effect to the note.

properties.name: ss
properties.label: ss
properties.documentation: Adds a shift slide effect to the note.

properties.name: sib
properties.label: sib
properties.documentation: Adds a slide effect into the note from below.

properties.name: sia
properties.label: sia
properties.documentation: Adds a slide effect into the note from above.

properties.name: sou
properties.label: sou
properties.documentation: Adds a slide effect out from note upwards.

properties.name: sod
properties.label: sod
properties.documentation: Adds a slide effect out from note downwards.

properties.name: psu
properties.label: psu
properties.documentation: Adds a pick slide effect out from note upwards.

properties.name: psd
properties.label: psd
properties.documentation: Adds a pick slide effect out from note downwards.

properties.name: h
properties.label: h
properties.documentation:
Applies a hammer on / pull-off effect to the note.

The fret of the following note on the same string defines whether it is a hammer-on or pull-of.

properties.name: lht
properties.label: lht
properties.documentation: Applies a left-hand-tapped annotation to the note.

properties.name: g
properties.label: g
properties.documentation: Marks the note as a ghost note.

properties.name: ac
properties.label: ac
properties.documentation: Applies a simple accentuation to the note.

properties.name: hac
properties.label: hac
properties.documentation: Applies a heavy accentuation to the note.

properties.name: ten
properties.label: ten
properties.documentation: Applies a tenuto accentuation to the note.

properties.name: tr
properties.label: tr
properties.documentation: Applies a trill effect to the note.

properties.name: pm
properties.label: pm
properties.documentation: Applies a palm mute effect to the note.

properties.name: st
properties.label: st
properties.documentation: Applies a staccato effect to the note.

properties.name: lr
properties.label: lr
properties.documentation: Applies a LetRing effect to the note.

properties.name: x
properties.label: x
properties.documentation: Marks the note as a dead note.

properties.name: t
properties.label: t
properties.documentation:
Marks the note as a tied note.

This is an alternative syntax to directly specifying the fret as `-`.

For non stringed instrument it can be a bit more tricky as we cannot use the string to identify which note to tie. There are multiple ways to work around this problem. AlphaTab will try to find the start note for the tie via several rules, if this does not match the desired behavior, you can specify the note value as alternative and indicate the tie via a note effect.

properties.name: turn
properties.label: turn
properties.documentation: Applies a turn ornament to the note.

properties.name: iturn
properties.label: iturn
properties.documentation: Applies an inverted turn ornament to the note.

properties.name: umordent
properties.label: umordent
properties.documentation: Applies an upper mordent ornament to the note.

properties.name: lmordent
properties.label: lmordent
properties.documentation: Applies an lower mordent ornament to the note.

properties.name: string
properties.label: string
properties.documentation: Adds an annotation showing the string number of the note above the staff.

properties.name: hide
properties.label: hide
properties.documentation: Hides the note from being displayed in the music sheet.

properties.name: b
properties.label: b
properties.documentation:
Adds a bend effect to the note.

* The `b` variant automatically spreads the values across the duration of the beat.
* The `be` (exact) variant allows specifying exactly at which offset a value is placed.

It is recommended to rely on the auto-detection of the type and only specify the type explicitly if something is wrong.

properties.name: be
properties.label: be
properties.documentation:
Adds an exact bend effect to the note.

* The `b` variant automatically spreads the values across the duration of the beat.
* The `be` (exact) variant allows specifying exactly at which offset a value is placed.

It is recommended to rely on the auto-detection of the type and only specify the type explicitly if something is wrong.

properties.name: lf
properties.label: lf
properties.documentation: Adds a left-hand fingering annotation to the note.

properties.name: rf
properties.label: rf
properties.documentation: Adds a right-hand fingering annotation to the note.

properties.name: acc
properties.label: acc
properties.documentation: Changes the mode to determine the accidentals for this note.

properties.name: slur
properties.label: slur
properties.documentation: Marks the start or end of a slur for the note.

Marks the note as a tied note.

This is an alternative syntax to directly specifying the fret as `-`.

For non stringed instrument it can be a bit more tricky as we cannot use the string to identify which note to tie. There are multiple ways to work around this problem. AlphaTab will try to find the start note for the tie via several rules, if this does not match the desired behavior, you can specify the note value as alternative and indicate the tie via a note effect.
